text: Ahmed Ammi (; born 19 January 1981) is a Dutch-Moroccan footballer who plays as a right defender. He currently plays for Dutch amateur outfit SC Irene. ==Club career== Ammi was born in Temsamane, Morocco, but moved to the Netherlands at a young age. He started playing football for local amateur side, SV Blerick, but was added to the youth department of VVV-Venlo, who at that time were known as VVV. He made his debut in the 2000–01 season, when VVV played in the Dutch second division. Ammi made his next step in 2006, when he signed with NAC Breda. After playing only one season in Breda, he moved on to ADO Den Haag in 2008. He moved to German Regionalliga West club KFC Uerdingen 05 in January 2014Schulz, Ammi und Sevinc unterschreiben beim KFC – Kicker and played for EVV,Ahmed Ammi naar EVV – 1Limburg before joining fellow amateur side SC Irene in summer 2016.Spelerscarrousel: Sportclub Irene bindt Ahmed Ammi aan zich – In de Wandelgangen ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:People from Oriental (Morocco) Category:Dutch people of Moroccan descent Category:Moroccan emigrants to the Netherlands Category:Association football fullbacks Category:Moroccan footballers Category:Dutch footballers Category:VVV-Venlo players Category:NAC Breda players Category:ADO Den Haag players Category:KFC Uerdingen 05 players Category:Eredivisie players Category:Eerste Divisie players Category:Moroccan expatriate footballers Category:Dutch expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Germany Category:Dutch expatriate sportspeople in Germany
title: Ahmed Ammi
